medical_history.chief_complaint: 12 hours of epigastric abdominal pain, nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began 12 hours prior to presentation, with the pain being constant and sharp, radiating to both flanks and back. The patient has experienced similar self-limited RUQ/epigastric pain episodes in the past, but this episode was more intense.
